notes: Discovery conducted through comprehensive web research of GOV.UK Home Office services using WebSearch and WebFetch tools. Research completed on 2025-10-26 with focused investigation mode (10-15 tool calls). Coverage includes: (1) Passport services - applications, renewals, tracking, emergency documents, fast track/premium services, lost/stolen reporting, name/gender changes; (2) Immigration status - eVisas, share codes, right to work verification, UKVI account management; (3) Visa applications - student, work, family, visitor, settlement routes including 28+ different visa types; (4) Citizenship and settlement - ILR, naturalisation, Life in UK test, citizenship ceremonies, certificate services; (5) Specialist visas - BNO, Ukraine schemes (family & sponsorship), Afghan schemes (ARAP/ACRS), ancestry, youth mobility; (6) Work visas - skilled worker, health care, global talent, graduate, HPI, innovator founder, seasonal, scale-up, creative worker, charity worker, government authorised exchange, senior/specialist worker, India young professionals; (7) Right to work - employer checking, share code services, sponsorship management; (8) Support services - asylum claims, travel documents (refugee/stateless), appeals (First-tier & Upper Tribunal), DBS checks, assisted digital, reporting; (9) Electronic Travel Authorisation (ETA) system. All services are production-facing on www.gov.uk or *.service.gov.uk domains. Services represent the complete range of Home Office digital touchpoints for UK citizens, international visitors, immigrants, employers, sponsors, and service providers. Significantly exceeded target of 50 services with 90 unique Home Office digital services discovered covering passports (9), visas/immigration (40+), citizenship (8), settlement (6), right to work (5), appeals (2), special schemes (4), support services (6+), and employer services (4).
